meanings.definition: Make (a problem, bad situation, or negative feeling) worse.
meanings.sent1: Yelling only acerbates the argument further.
meanings.sent2: Adding fuel to the fire only acerbates the situation.
meanings.sent3: His constant complaining only acerbates the situation, but we can't help but laugh.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the warning signs will only acerbate the impending disaster.
meanings.sent5: The storm's intensity acerbates the already dire conditions.

meanings.sent1: The buzzing sound of the mosquito acerbates me during the night.
meanings.sent2: Her constant tapping on the desk acerbates everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: His off-key singing acerbates the audience, but they can't help but smile.
meanings.sent4: The repetitive noise of the dripping faucet acerbates my nerves.
meanings.sent5: The persistent itch on my arm acerbates me to the point of frustration.
